title.narrative: Dhaka Environmentally Sustainable Water Supply Project

description.narrative: The project will provide more reliable and improved security of water supply in Dhaka by developing a new surface water supply scheme for supply augmentation, which includes the development of a water intake at Meghna River, a raw water transmission pipeline, a water treatment plant (WTP) at Gandharbpur with capacity of 500 million liters per day (MLD), a treated water transmission pipeline to the existing water supply network, and distribution reinforcements. The project will also include distribution network improvements to reduce nonrevenue water (NRW); and will improve the quality of water supply services, including support to low-income communities.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: More reliable and improved security of water supply in Dhaka.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Water supply pressure of at least 1 bar at consumer end (baseline: 0.2-0.3 bars in 2012).

description.narrative: More reliable and improved security of water supply in Dhaka.

title.narrative: Dependence on groundwater reduced to 30% (baseline: 100% in 2012 except zone 6).
